metadata.title: CVE-2018-12121 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Node.js: All versions prior to Node.js 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0: Denial of Service with large HTTP headers: By using a combination of many requests with maximum sized headers (almost 80 KB per connection), and carefully timed completion of the headers, it is possible to cause the HTTP server to abort from heap allocation failure. Attack potential is mitigated by the use of a load balancer or other proxy layer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-12121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
nodejs - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
No subscription required

notes.note: msalvatore> RedHat found that the patch from the november-2018 security release caused some regressions. The patches below are perhapse a better approach to resolving this CVE. http-parser must be patched. I'm deferring this until a http-parser v2.9.0 makes it into the archive.

criterions.comment: nodejs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.15.1~dfsg-5').
